conclusion: Ideal gas changes from state A to B to C; find temperature at state C.
p-V diagram with x-axis as volume (10^-3 m³) and y-axis as pressure (10^5 Pa); points A, B, C.
Point A: pressure 3 × 10^5 Pa, volume 1 × 10^-3 m³.
Point B: pressure 1 × 10^5 Pa, volume 1 × 10^-3 m³.
Point C: pressure 1 × 10^5 Pa, volume 3 × 10^-3 m³.
A to B is an isochoric process; B to C is an isobaric process.
Use ideal gas law: PV = nRT.
For A to B (isochoric): T_B = (P_B / P_A) * T_A = 100 K.
For B to C (isobaric): T_C = (V_C / V_B) * T_B = 300 K.
Temperature at state C is 300 K.
Check using combined gas law for A to C: T_C = 300 K.
Temperature at state C is 300 K, which is 27°C.
